meanings.definition: A group of muscles served by a single spinal nerve root.
meanings.sent1: After my injury, the doctor explained that myotomes are specific muscle groups controlled by certain nerves.
meanings.sent2: During the anatomy class, we learned about the myotomes and how they are connected to the spinal nerves.
meanings.sent3: The myotomes in my back seem to have a mind of their own, twitching at the most unexpected times.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were so fluid and precise, it was as if her myotomes were choreographed to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The physical therapist used a model to show how myotomes work together to create movement in the body.

meanings.definition: The segmental muscle masses of the body.
meanings.sent1: The athlete focused on strengthening his myotomes to improve his overall muscle mass.
meanings.sent2: In the anatomy lab, we examined the myotomes to understand the distribution of muscle masses in the body.
meanings.sent3: The myotomes in his arms bulged with each movement, showcasing his strength and power.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a network of interconnected myotomes, each contributing to her success.
meanings.sent5: The bodybuilder's myotomes rippled with every flex, demonstrating the power of his segmented muscle masses.
